igpp.xml

Class XMLGrep

  • java.lang.Object
    • igpp.xml.XMLGrep

  • public class XMLGrep
extends Object
    Extract values from XML files using simplified XPath syntax that can contain regular expressions.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.4

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates an instance of a XML

      • open

        public Document open(String pathName)
              throws Exception
        Parses a file containing XML into its constitute elements. The path and name of the file are passed to the method which is opened and parsed.
        Parameters:
        pathName - the fully qualified path and name of the file to parse.
        Returns:
        A Document containing the parsed representation. null if parsing failed.
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • parse

                      throws Exception
        Parses a file containing XML into its constitute elements. The path and name of the file are passed to the method which is opened and parsed.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Exception

        1.0.0

      • parseString

        public static Document parseString(String text)
                            throws Exception
        Parses a string containing XML into its constitute elements.
        Parameters:
        text - the String containing the XML text.
        Returns:
        true if the file could be opened; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • parse

        public static Document parse(InputStream stream)
                      throws Exception
        Parses a file containing XML into its constitute elements. The file to parse must be previously opened and a InputStream pointing to the file is passed.
        Parameters:
        stream - a connection to a pre-opened file.
        Returns:
        A Document containing the parsed representation. null if parsing failed.
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getFirstValue

        public String getFirstValue(String xpath,
                            String defaultValue)
        Finds the first value that has an XPath which matches a given pattern. Works with XML documents opened with a call to "open()".
        Parameters:
        xpath - The XPath of the value to look for. The XPath can contain regular expressions.
        defaultValue - the default value to return if no matching item is found.
        Returns:
        a String containing the value or the default value if no matching XPath is found.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getFirstValue

        public static String getFirstValue(ArrayList<Pair> list,
                                   String xpath,
                                   String defaultValue)
        Finds the first value that has an XPath which matches a given pattern.
        Parameters:
        list - a list of XPath/Value pairs.
        xpath - The XPath of the value to look for. The XPath can contain regular expressions.
        defaultValue - the default value to return if no matching item is found.
        Returns:
        a String containing the value or the default value if no matching XPath is found.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • changePath

        public static void changePath(ArrayList<Pair> list,
                              String match,
                              String set)
        Change the path for each pair in a list using a pattern.
        Parameters:
        list - a list of XPath/Value pairs.
        match - a regular expression for the portion of the path to change.
        set - the value to substitute for the matched pattern.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getSegment

        public ArrayList<Pair> getSegment(int startAt,
                                  int endAt)
        Extract a copy of a portion of a ArrayList. Works with XML documents opened with a call to "open()".
        Parameters:
        startAt - the index to start the extract.
        endAt - the index to end the extract.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList will all items between startAt and endAt.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getSegment

      • findFirstElement

        public int findFirstElement(String xpath,
                            int startAt)
        Find the first item that has an XPath that begins with a given XPath. Search begins at a given index in the ArrayList. Works with XML documents opened with a call to "open()".
        Parameters:
        xpath - The XPath pattern of the value to look for.
        startAt - the index to start the search.
        Returns:
        the index in the ArrayList of the first matching element or -1 if no matching element was found.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • findFirstElement

        public static int findFirstElement(ArrayList<Pair> list,
                                   String xpath,
                                   int startAt)
        Find the first item that has an XPath that begins with a given XPath. Search begins at a given index in the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        list - a list of XPath/Value pairs.
        xpath - The XPath pattern of the value to look for.
        startAt - the index to start the search.
        Returns:
        the index in the ArrayList of the first matching element or -1 if no matching element was found.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • findLastElement

        public int findLastElement(String xpath,
                           int startAt)

        Parameters:

        startAt - the index to start the search.
        Returns:

        Since:

      • writeXMLTagged

        public static void writeXMLTagged(Node node)
        Prints the XML document to the currently define System.out. Each node is labeled with its XPath.
        Parameters:
        node - the starting Node in the document to print.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • writeXMLTagged

        public static void writeXMLTagged(PrintStream out,
                                  Node node)
        Prints the XML document to a @link{PrintStream} Each node is labeled with its XPath.
        Parameters:
        out - the @link{PrintStream} to send the output.
        node - the starting Node in the document to print.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • writeXMLTagged

        public static void writeXMLTagged(PrintStream out,
                                  ArrayList<Pair> list,
                                  int startAt,
                                  int endAt,
                                  String pattern)
        Prints the list of XPath/Value pairs to a @link{PrintStream}
        Parameters:
        out - the @link{PrintStream} to send the output.
        list - the list of pairs to print.
        startAt - the index of the first pair to print.
        endAt - the index of the last pair to print.
        pattern - the regex for matching content. If null no checking is done.
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • writeXMLTagged

      • writeXMLTagged

        public static void writeXMLTagged(PrintStream out,
                                  Pair<String,String> item,
                                  boolean indent)
        Prints an XPath/Value pair to a @link{PrintStream}
        Parameters:
        out - the @link{PrintStream} to send the output.
        item - the XPath/Value pair to print.
        indent - if true then tag is indented to match nesting level.
        Since:
        1.0.0
